conclusion: Initial analysis of the problem scenario
Motorcycle rides up a curved surface to a horizontal platform at a height of 0.8 meters
Motorcycle leaves the platform with a horizontal velocity of 3 m/s
Motorcycle undergoes projectile motion from the platform to point A
Motorcycle enters a smooth vertical circular track at point A along the tangent of the arc without collision
Given values: height of the platform, horizontal velocity, radius of the circular track, total mass, gravity
Objective: Find the horizontal distance s from the platform to point A
Analyze the projectile motion from the platform to point A
Vertical displacement during t2 is the height of the platform, which is 0.8 m
Vertical motion equation: y = - (1/2) g t², since v_y = 0
At time t2, y = -0.8 m, leading to t2² = 0.16
Time of flight t2 = √0.16 = 0.4 s
Horizontal distance s = v * t2 = 3 m/s * 0.4 s = 1.2 m
Consider the circular motion at point A
Motorcycle lands at point A and follows the tangent of the arc without collision
Arc AB is part of a circle with radius R = 1.0 m
Angle θ is the angle subtended by point A from the center O
Connecting line AB is horizontal, so vertical position of point B is the same as point A
Relate the projectile motion to the circular motion
Velocity components at time t2: v_x = 3 m/s, v_y = -4 m/s
Velocity vector at point A is v_A = (3 m/s, -4 m/s)
Direction of velocity: tan(φ) = v_y / v_x = -4 / 3, φ = tan⁻¹(-4/3) = -53.13°
